page.title: 10Rogart - Trade (Miss Pirie)
page.content: Miss Pirie owns a tweed shop in Rogart. The building is over a hundred years old and Miss Pirie has always worked there. She sells cuddly toys,silver and gold jewellery, woollen jerseys, tweed, tartan and lots of souvenirs. She doesn't make any of the items sold in the shop herself, but most of the items are made in Scotland by Scottish craftsmen. Most of her customers are people she knows. Many tourists call in, including foreign visitors. Perhaps her most famous customers are the family of Robert Maclennan, the Socialist Democratic Member of Parliament for Caithness and Sutherland. Miss Pirie would hate to live in the city. She loves living in the country and enjoys meeting people.
